title: Die abgenöthige Einwilligung
notes: Adapted from Le Consentement forcé

title: Adelaide, oder die Antipathie gegen die Liebe
sort_title: adelaide, oder die antipathie gegen die liebe
notes: Adapted from Du Doyer's Adélaïde ou l'Antipathie contre l'amour (1780)

title: Adelheid von Ponthieu
notes: Noverre and Starzer's ballet d'action in 5 acts Adèle de Ponthieu was first performed in the Burgtheater in 1773. The ballet performed in 1781 might have been the "imitation" by "Herr Vogt" (either Peter or his brother Elias) that was in the repertory of the Böhm company from at least 1779; see https://sites.google.com/site/mozartdocuments/documents/1780-05-01.

title: Adelheit von Veltheim
notes: The composer attribution is from the title page of the Viennese libretto; it is not Neefe's setting. The music for Sardi's version is unknown. "Aufgefüht im k. k. Nationaltheater von der in / der Schauspielkunst sich übenden Jugend."

title: Der Adjutant
notes: In the repertory of the Nationaltheater since 23 Oct 1779.

title: Adrast und Isidore, oder die Nachtmusik
sort_title: adrast und isidore, oder die nachtmusik
notes: Performed only twice

title: Der Aepfeldieb
notes: "Herr Jast" is the attribution on the libretto. Perhaps Just?

title: Agamemnon
notes: Noverre's Agamemnon vengé was first performed in Vienna in 1772 with music by Franz Aspelmayr. The ballet performed in 1781 was probably Decamp's "Wiederhestellung" of Noverre's scenario, Der gerächte Agamemnon (Vienna 1780).

title: Aline, reine de Golconde
notes: Viennese libretto, 1780: "Representé pour la premiere fois à Vienne, pour le / Benefice de M. DUPONT." Monsigny and Sedaine's opéra-ballet Aline, reine da Golconde was first performed in Paris on 12 Apr 1766 with choreography by Jean-Barthèlemy Lany.

title: L'Amant jaloux, ou les Fausses Apparences
sort_title: amant jaloux, ou les fausses apparences
notes: L'Amant jaloux, with music by Grétry, a book by Thomas Hales, and verse sections by F. Levasseur, was first performed at Versailles on 20 Nov 1778.

title: L'Amant, Auteur et Valet
notes: Cérou's L'Amant, Auteur et Valet was first performed in Paris by the Comédiens italiens on 8 Feb 1740.

title: L'Ami de la maison
notes: L'Ami de la maison was first performed at Fontainebleau on 26 Oct 1771.

title: L'Amitié à l'epreuve
notes: First performed at Fontainebleau on 13 Nov 1770.

title: L'Amoreux de quinze ans
notes: First performed by the Comédiens italiens in Paris on 18 Apr 1771.

title: Andromeda und Perseus
notes: "Ein Schauspiel mit Musik"

title: Ariadne auf Naxos
notes: Brandes and Benda's Ariadne auf Naxos was first performed in Gotha on 27 Jan 1775. The first performance by the court theater in Vienna took place on 4 Jan 1780.The performance iin the Burgtheater on Fri, 11 May 1781 may have been a benefit. It is not listed in Hadamowsky.

title: Der Arrestant
notes: The attribution to Franke is from Hadamowsky.

title: Athelstan
notes: First performed in 1756. Translator/adapter unknown

title: L'Avocat Patelin
notes: First performed by the Comédiens françois in Paris on 4 Jun 1706.

title: Le Barbier de Séville
notes: Le Barbier de Séville was first performed by the Comédie Française in Paris on 23 Feb 1775.

title: Les Battus paient l'amende
notes: Two works with this subtitle on CÉSAR: Le Poulet ou les Battu paient l'amende (Carrogis, 1768); Janot, ou les Battus paient l'amende (Archambault, 1779). Schletter's "patient" is evidently an error.

title: Bauern verstehn nicht Spaß
notes: This ballet remains unidentified.

title: La Belle Arsène
notes: La Belle Arsène was first performed at Fontainebleau on 6 Nov 1773.

title: La Belle Cordonniere
notes: This may be Les souliers mors-dorés, ou La cordonniere allemande (1776). The Schatz record gives the composer as Alessandro Mario Antonio Fridzeri (1741–1825).

title: Betrug für Betrug
notes: Burgtheater premiere on 30 Sep 1780

title: Der Bettelstudent
notes: Did the version performed in 1781 already have the music by Peter von Winter?

title: La Bonne Fille
notes: This might be the work by Duni (1762), derived from Goldoni/Richardson, but the French version of Piccinni's opera cannot be ruled out.

title: Le Bûcheron, ou les Trois souhaits
notes: First performed in Paris on 28 Feb 1763. Date on Viennese libretto at link is 1768.

title: Le Cercle, ou la Soirée à la mode
sort_title: cercle, ou la soiree à la mode
notes: The Viennese playbook linked below is dated 1768.

title: La Clochette
notes: First performed in Paris on 14 Jul 1766.

title: Der Codrus
notes: The earliest Viennese performance in Hadamowsky is 1 Apr 1771 in the Kärntnertortheater. Der Codrus had been in the repertory of the Nationaltheater since 4 Sep 1777.

title: La Colonie
notes: A parody of Saccini's L'isola d'amore, using a pastiche of music from Sacchini's operas. First performed in Paris on 16 Aug 1775.Libretto also here: https://digital.library.unt.edu/ark:/67531/metadc41/

title: La Comédie à l'impromptu, ou les Dupes
sort_title: comedie à l'impromptu, ou les dupes
notes: Attribution to Dorvigny is on the title page. First performed by the Comédiens Italiens in Paris on 5 Sep 1780.Apparently the same work as Le mariage par comédie, ou les dupes, dated to 1789 in the works list on fr.wikipedia.

title: Concert
notes: A generic record for concerts

title: Crispin médecin
notes: Written in 1670. The Viennese libretto at the link is dated 1772.

title: Crispin, Rival de son maître
notes: First dated performance Paris 15 Mar 1705 (CÉSAR).

title: Democrite amoureux
notes: First performed in Paris on 12 Jan 1700.

title: Le Déserteur
notes: First performed by the Comédiens Italiens in Paris on 6 Mar 1769. The performance by the court theater in Vienna on 1 Aug 1781 was in German as a singspiel.

title: Der Deserteur aus Kindesliebe
notes: Earliest performance in Hadamowsky is 31 Jul 1773.

title: Les Deux Avares
notes: First performed at Fontainebleau on 27 Oct 1770.

title: Les Deux Billets
notes: First performed in Paris on 9 Feb 1779.

title: Les Deux Chasseurs et la Laitière
notes: First performed in Paris on 23 Jul 1763. The date on the Viennese libretto at the link is 1764.

title: Der Dienstfertige
notes: Author attribution from Hadamowsky. Possibly after L'Officieux (1780)?The German version is attributed to Schletter in the catalogue of the ÖNB. Schletter's calendar attributes it to Wieland. Der Dienstfertige is not listed among Wieland's works on de.wikipedia.https://books.google.com/books?id=dCy9g7qFyTsC&pg=PA1#v=onepage&q&f=false

title: Divertissement
notes: This divertissement is not in Hadamowsky.

title: Don Japhet d'Armenie
notes: First performed in 1651 or 1652; first published in 1653.

title: Der Dorfdeputirten
notes: Apparently not the same as the singspiel by this name by Heermann and Franz Teyber performed in the Kärntnertortheater twice in 1785 and 1786. There was also a setting by Wolf. The libretto is based on Goldoni, Il feudatario. Presumably Sardi set the same libretto.

title: La Double Frayeur
notes: Apart from Schletter, this title appears only in Schink 1782. Two titles with "frayeur" in the title appear on CÉSAR: Les Frayeurs d'Arlequin (no date) and Les Frayeurs de Crispin (1682).

title: Dupuis et Desronais
notes: According to CÉSAR, first performed in Paris in 1759.

title: L'École des femmes
notes: First performed in 1662. The Viennese playbook at the link is dated 1752.

title: Edelmuth in Niedrigkeit
notes: The playbook at the link (ÖNB) was published in Leipzig in 1777.

title: Edwin und Emma
notes: Schraembl is principally known as a cartographer.

title: Die eifersüchtige Ehefrau
notes: Based on The Jealous Wife by George Colman the Elder. First performed in the Kärtnertortheater on 10 Dec 1769.

title: Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber
notes: German adaptation of L'amant jaloux, ou Les fausses apparences

title: Die eingebildeten Philosophen
notes: German version of I filosofi immaginari (1779)

title: Elfride
notes: From Mason's Elfrida (1752).

title: Elle a raison
notes: Full title in Schletter: Elle a Raison, ou la Femme, comme il n'y en a guverres. No Google hit on this title except in Bender, apparently derived from Schletter. This title seems not to be in Schink's list. "guverre" seems not to be a French word. It should probably be "la Femme, comme il n'y en a guères", but no hits on this as the title of a comedy. There is no match for this title on CÉSAR.There is a story by d'Abancourt (pub. 1778) "Le Phénix, ou la Femme comme il n'y en a guères." Cf. also Voltaire's La Femme qui a Raison (pub. 1759)?

title: L'Epoux par supercherie
notes: First performed in Paris on 9 Mar 1744.

title: Die Eroberung von Saint-Lucie
notes: Adapted from Müller von Friedberg, La Prise de Sainte-Lucie. Performed only three times.

title: L'Erreur d'un moment, ou la Suite de Julie
sort_title: erreur d'un moment, ou la suite de julie
notes: First performed in Paris on 14 Jun 1773.

title: Eugenie, oder Die Tugend in Gefahr
sort_title: eugenie, oder die tugend in gefahr
notes: From Beaumarchais's Eugénie (1767)

title: Les Evénements imprévus
notes: First performed at Versailles on 11 Nov 1779.

title: Die Familie
notes: Roles of Gemmingen and Schröder?

title: Die Faßbinder
notes: There is a reference to a one-act ballet Die Faßbinder in Westenrieder's Jahrbuch der Menschengeschichte in Bayrern (1782), in a list of "Ballete von Hrn. Hornung, der im April 1780 von Regensburg abging", here:https://books.google.com/books?id=p9ZSzsm9QAoC&pg=PA238#v=onepage&q&f=false

title: La Fausse Magie
notes: First performed in Paris on 1 Feb 1775.

title: La Fausse Suivante
notes: First performed in Paris on 8 Jul 1724.

title: La Fée Urgèle
notes: First performed at Fontainebleau on 26 Oct 1765.

title: La Fenisse
notes: No work with this title on CÉSAR.

title: Der flatterhafte Ehemann
notes: Adapted from Cibber's The Careless Husband

title: Les Folies amoureuses
notes: First dated perfomance in Paris on 15 Jan 1704.

title: Les Fourberies de Scapin
notes: First performed in Paris on 24 May 1671.

title: Le François à Londres
notes: First performed in Paris on 3 Jul 1727.

title: Das Gärtnermädchen von Fraskati
notes: Adapted from La frascatana.

title: Der Geburtstag
notes: Performed once by the Nationaltheater on 7 Feb 1779. This performance on 28 Dec 1781 is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps Theaterschule?

title: Die Gefahren der Verführung
notes: Free adaptation of Mercier's Jenneval, ou le Barnevelt français (1769)

title: Die gegenseitige Probe
notes: Adapted from L'eprouve reciproque.

title: Die Gunst der Fürsten
notes: First performed by the court theater in 1773. Ultimately derived from The Unhappy Favourite or The Earl of Essex by John Banks.

title: Der gutherzige Murrkopf
notes: After Goldoni's Il burbero benefico

title: Hanns bleibt Hanns, oder der Bauer, ein Fürst
sort_title: hanns bleibt hanns, oder der bauer, ein fuerst

title: Der Hausfreund
notes: Adapted from L'Ame de maison

title: Die heimliche Heyrath
notes: Adapted from Colman's The clandestine marriage (1766)

title: Henriette
notes: Henriette, oder Sie ist schon verheiratet

title: Héraclite, ou le Triomphe de la Beauté
sort_title: heraclite, ou le triomphe de la beaute
notes: The title page of the 1783 edition has "Représentée pour la premiere fois à Paris, par les Comédiens Italiens ordinaires du Roi, le Décembre 1783."

title: Die Holländer
notes: First performed by the court theater in the Burgtheater on 14 Nov 1778.

title: L'Homme du jour
notes: Comèdie en vers

title: L'Homme noir, ou le Spleen
notes: Earliest edition on WorldCat is 1778. This work has two acts, whereas Schletter has "3. A."

title: Die Horazier
notes: Noverre's ballet d'action Les Horaces et les Curiaces, with music by Starzer, was first performed in Vienna in 1772. The ballet performed in 1781 might have been Peter Vogt's "imitation," Die Horazier und Kuriazier.

title: Le Huron
notes: First performed in 1768

title: Il natale di Apollo
notes: Righini’s Il natale di Apollo is usually said to have been composed for the TKS concert in Dec 1789. If “Apolls Geburtstag” on 18 and 25 Mar 1781 is the same work, this places it considerably earlier.

title: L'Impromptu du coeur
notes: Five items on CÉSAR with the title L'Impromptu du coeur. Could this be a kind of generic title?

title: Inkle und Yariko
notes: On versions of this story, see Walton 2005

title: Der Jahrmarkt von Venedig
notes: After Salieri's La fiera di Venezia

title: Jenny, oder die Uneigennützigkeit
notes: Translation of Jenni, out le Désintéressement (1771)

title: Le Jugement de Midas
notes: First performed publicly in Paris by the Comédiens Italiens on 27 Jun 1778.

title: Julie
notes: First performed in Paris on 22 Sep 1772.

title: Die junge Indianerinn
notes: A translation of La junge Indienne. Hadamowsky gives no translator.

title: Die kleine Aehrenleserin
notes: "Lustspiel für Kinder"

title: Der kleine Grenadier
notes: The attribution is from Schletter. This title is not in Einakter, and it seems not to be listed in Goedeke.

title: Der Kobold
notes: Adapted from L'Esprit follet, ou la Dame invisible (1770).

title: Das Landmädchen
notes: Apparently Wycherley's The Country Wife, perhaps by way of Garrick's cleaned up version as The Country Girl.

title: Leonardo und Blandine
notes: The Augsburg libretto at LOC is attributed to Goez, but Schletter attributes the text to Babo.

title: Der letzte Rausch
notes: Apparently a German adaptation of L'Ivrogne corrigé.

title: Die Liebe unter den Handwerksleuten
notes: German version of L'amore artigiano

title: Der Liebhaber als ein Schriftsteller und Bedienter
sort_title: liebhaber als ein schriftsteller und bedienter
notes: From Cérou's L'Amant, auteur et valet (1740). The attribution to Martin is from Hadamowsky and hasn't been verified/

title: Lucile
notes: First performed in Paris on 5 Jan 1769.

title: Le Magnifique
notes: First performed in Paris by the Comédiens Italiens on 4 Mar 1773.

title: Le Maître en droit
notes: First performed at the Foire Saint-Germain in Paris on 23 Feb 1760. The date on the Viennese libretto is 1763.

title: Le Marchand de Smyrne
notes: The attribution of this work is uncertain. Chamfort's one-act comedy Le Marchand de Smyrne was first performed in Paris on 26 Jan 1770. However, Schletter's entry specifies an opera ("O. 1. a."). The only plausible match found so far is the work by Just, but the only libretto online is in Dutch. Probably not Vogler's Der Kaufmann von Smyrna.

title: Le Mazet
notes: Also Mazet (without article)

title: Die Mediceer
notes: First performed by the Nationaltheater on 11 May 1776.

title: Le Mercure galant ou la Comédie sans titre
sort_title: mercure galant ou la comedie sans titre

title: Merope
notes: Performed in the Burgtheater on 17 Apr 1775. The performance on 30 Jan 1782 was the work's premiere by the Nationaltheater.

title: Le Milicien
notes: "Comedie en  acte mêlée d'ariettes"First performed 1762https://archive.org/details/lemilicien00duni/page/n7/mode/2up

title: Milton und Elmire
notes: The attribution to Reinwald is from Goggle Books, and needs to be investigated. The attribution to Michl is from Grove.

title: Monsieur de St. Charles
notes: The work and author identification appear on several lists published in the 1780s.

title: Die Näscherinn
notes: https://books.google.com/books?id=lWYPyjNCuAAC&pg=PA1#v=onepage&q&f=false

title: Nanette et Lucas, ou La Paysanne curieuse
sort_title: nanette et lucas, ou la paysanne curieuse
notes: "Comedie en prose, melée d'ariettes"

title: Die Nebenbuhler
notes: From Sheridan's The Rivals (1775)

title: Ninette à la cour
notes: First performed in Paris on 12 Feb 1755. Songs taken from Bertoldo in corte (1753) by Ciampi.

title: L'Officier et le grand Baillif
notes: Unidentified

title: L'Olympiade, ou le Triomphe de l'amitié
sort_title: olympiade, ou le triomphe de l'amitie
notes: French pasticcio, first performed in Paris on 2 Oct 1777.

title: On ne s'avise jamais de tout
sort_title: on ne s'avise jamais de tout
notes: First performed at the Foire Saint-Laurent in Paris, 14 Sep 1761

title: Le Page étourdi
notes: Unidentified

title: Percy
notes: In Schletter: "Percy. / Tr. in 5. A. a. d. E. v. einer Damme."

title: Peter du bleibst, oder Der Hausfreund auf dem Lande
sort_title: peter du bleibst, oder der hausfreund auf dem lande
notes: Apparently no libretto online.

title: Philotas
notes: Hadamowsky and Von Alth/Obzyna have two performances of Philotas by the court theater in 1782, the first on 22 Jan. This performance on Fri, 9 Nov 1781 is not given in either.

title: Die Pilgrime von Mekka
notes: Singpiel version of La rencontre imprévue.

title: Le Procureur arbitre
notes: Given by Schletter as "O. 1. a.", but Poisson's work is described only as "comédie en vers" with no mention of music. No other works with this title are listed in CÉSAR.

title: Le Pucheron
notes: No work by this title on CÉSAR, and no Google hits. Perhaps "bûcheron"? Several titles on CÉSAR contain this word, of which the most likely may be the comédie mêlée d'ariettes Le Bûcheron ou les Trois Souhaits by Guichard and Philidor.

title: Die pücefarbnen Schuhe, oder Die schöne Schusterin
sort_title: puecefarbnen schuhe, oder die schoene schusterin
notes: Based on a French original by Baron du Serrières

title: La Pupille
notes: First performed in Paris in 1734.

title: Reinhold und Armida
notes: First performed in Munich in Jun 1780. The work was performed once by the court theater on 7 Sep 1793 as Armida und Rinaldo (text at the link below). The performances on Fridays in 1781 were probably benefits, possibly for Winter, who seems still to have been in Vienna?

title: Robert und Kalliste
notes: Adapted from Guglielmi's La sposa fedele (1766)

title: La Rosière de Salency
notes: According to fr.wikipedia, the music is by Blaise, Philidor, Monsigny, and Duni.

title: Sancho Pança dans son isle
notes: First performed in Paris on 8 Jul 1762.

title: Santa Elena al Calvario
notes: First version 1747, second version 1772.

title: Sara ou la Fermière ecossaise
notes: First performed in Paris on 8 May 1773.

title: Die schöne Nanette
notes: Performed only once by the court theater.

title: Die Schwiegermütter
notes: On the title page of the Viennese playbook: "Auf dem k. k. Hof=Nationaltheater aufgeführt von der in der Schauspielkunst sich übenden Jugend." The author attribution is from Schletter and Schink 1782.

title: Der sehende Blinde
notes: Based on L'Aveugle clairvoyant

title: La Sérénade
notes: Le Bouquet de Louison ou la sérénade de village by Taconet is the only 18th-c. one-act opéra on CÉSAR with "sérénade" in the title.

title: La Servante maitresse
notes: "Comédie en deux actes, melée d'ariettes, parodiées de La Serva Padrona"

title: Die sieben Schwaben
notes: Evidently based on the German fairy tale of this name. Kunn's company performed this ballet in Salzburg on 13 Oct 1783 (see MBA vi:156, notes to line 152 of Nannerl Mozart's diary).

title: Der Sklavenhändler von Smyrna
notes: Derived from Chamfort, Le Marchand de Smyrne (1770). The ÖNB has a one-act Lustspiel Der Sklavenhändler von Smyrna based on Chamfort, translated by Brahm. Singspiel versions survive under the title Der Kaufmann von Smyrna with music by Vogler (Mannheim), and Andreas Franz Holly (Holy; Belin 1775). There seems to be no libretto or score corresponding to the 1781 production in the ÖNB.

title: Die Sklavinn
notes: From Piccinni's Gli stravaganti, ossia La schiava riconosciuta, first performed in Rome on 1 Jan 1764.

title: Soliman der Zweyte, oder Die drey Sultaninnen
sort_title: soliman der zweyte, oder die drey sultaninnen
notes: Translation of Soliman Second

title: Le Somnambule
notes: First performed in Paris in 1739.

title: Stirbt der Fuchs, so gilt sein Balg
sort_title: stirbt der fuchs, so gilt sein balg
notes: The playbook at the link is dated 1770.

title: Der Stolz des Grafen Barcelona
notes: Nothing is currently known about this work.

title: Le Tartuffe
notes: First performed in 1664

title: Der Teufel steckt in ihm
notes: Attribution to Colman is from Hadamowsky.

title: Der Todte ein Freyer
notes: Attribution to Sedaine is on title page. Adapted from Sedaine's Le mort marié/

title: Toinon et Toinette
notes: Toinon et Toinette was first performed in Paris on 20 Jun 1767.

title: Tom Jones
notes: After Fielding's Tom Jones

title: Die Trauer
notes: Adapted from Hauteroches's Le Deuil (1680)

title: Les Trois Fermiers
notes: First performed in Paris, 16 May 1777.

title: Les Trois Frères rivaux
notes: First performed in Paris on 4 Aug 1713. The Viennese playbook at the link is dated 1752.

title: Les Trois Jumeaux vénetiens
notes: First performed in Paris on 7 Dec 1773.

title: Turcaret
notes: Published in 1708. Also Turcaret ou le Financier.

title: Die Ungetreuen
notes: Adapted from Barthe's Les fausses infidélités.

title: Die unvermutheten Zufälle
notes: Adapted from Les Événements imprévues (1779).

title: Les Vendangeurs ou les Deux Baillis
notes: First performed in Paris on 7 Nov 1780. The playbook seems not to be online.

title: Die verfolgte Unbekannte
notes: German adaptation of L'incognita perseguitata.

title: Der verlogene Bediente
notes: From Garrick's The Lying Valet (1741)

title: Die wahre Liebe
notes: Identification  uncertain

title: Was erhält die Männer treu?
notes: Premiere in the Burgtheater on 1 May 1780

title: Die Wâschermädchen
notes: From Zanetti's Le lavanderine

title: Der Westindier
notes: Adapted from Cumberland's "The West Indian"

title: Die Widersprecherin
notes: Adapted from Dufresny's L'Esprit de contradiction (1700)

title: Die Wildschützen
notes: According to Hadamowsky, "Lustspiel mit Gesängen"

title: Wissenschaft geht vor Schönheit
notes: Kalliope record here: http://kalliope-verbund.info/DE-611-HS-3410222 has this as a translation by Bock of Goldoni's La donna garbo (1743).

title: Der Wittwer
notes: Based on Carmontelle's "Proverbe dramatique" Le Veuf.https://fr.wikisource.org/wiki/Proverbes_dramatiques/Le_Veuf

title: Zémire et Azor
notes: A German version of Zémire et Azor had been in the repertory of the court theater since 13 Oct 1779.

title: Zu gut ist nicht gut
notes: "nationalisieret von Herrn Schmidt." First performed by the Nationaltheater on 22 Nov 1777.

title: Die zwey Gräfinnen
notes: Adapted from Le due contesse.
